data.title: Gro Harlem Brundtland
meta_keywords: International Day of Women and Girls in Science
data.meta_description: Pesky gender gap got you down? Try the fast-acting elect-a-woman cure -- guaranteed or your kroner back!
data.text:
PRIME MINISTER

FIRSTfemale prime minister of Norway

After attending medical school, she earned her master of public health degree from Harvard University

Served as Norway's Minister for Environmental Affairs for five years

Elected Prime Minister of Norway three times, and filled almost half of her cabinet with women

Implemented many reforms aimed at bridging the gender gap, such as requiring quotas for women candidates for elections; many of these reforms were soon adopted by other Scandinavian countries​

Led the World Commission on Environment and Development (commonly referred to as the Brundtland Commission), and helped author a report titled Our Common Future, which popularized the concept of sustainable development, highlighting the links between health and environmental policy​

​After completing her final term as prime minister, she was elected director of the World Health Organization, where she emphasized that not only was poverty often a cause of poor health, but that poor public health was a detriment to economic growth in the developing world

Left the World Health Organization in 2003 and acted as an Environmental Envoy to the United Nations, as well as one of three Special Envoys for Climate Change
